title: 115_hr1227
content: The Act titled "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2017" amends the Controlled Substances Act to include regulations on marijuana. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2017" excludes marijuana from its regulations, making it illegal to transport marijuana across state lines for unlawful purposes. The Act "Ending Federal Marijuana Prohibition Act of 2017" excludes marijuana from regulations and prohibits its transportation across state lines for unlawful purposes. Violating this law can result in a fine, imprisonment, or both. The table of contents for the Comprehensive Drug Abuse Prevention and Control Act of 1970 is amended accordingly. SEC. 3. DEREGULATION OF MARIHUANA. The text chunk discusses the removal of marijuana and tetrahydrocannabinols from the Schedule I of the Controlled Substances Act. It also mentions the removal of prohibition on import and export of these substances. The text chunk involves renumbering and removing certain paragraphs related to the Controlled Substances Act. The text chunk involves making conforming amendments to the Controlled Substances Act. The Controlled Substances Act is amended to remove references to "marihuana" and make adjustments to various clauses in section 401(b). The Controlled Substances Act is amended by removing references to "marihuana" and making adjustments to various clauses in section 401(b), including striking certain subparagraphs and paragraphs. In amending the Controlled Substances Act, references to "marihuana" are removed and adjustments are made to various clauses in section 401(b), including striking specific subparagraphs and paragraphs.
